name: 10 Below
review description: We celebrated Father's Day at 10 Below and enjoyed our meal.

name: 3 Doors Down
review description: We had the Chicken Liver Pate for starters as we usually do; its the best in town. Our entrees were excellenta as they normally are. We dine here about once a month. We try all the finer restaurants in Portland and this is my most favorite.

name: 900 Wall
review description: Adored the Heirloom Tomato risotto . Still trying to figure out a way to have it Fed Exed to Milwaukee.Wi!

name: a Cena Ristorante
review description: Great food, super knowledgeable and super attentive staff, nice wine list at a moderate price with excellent pairing recommendations from waiter (and owner, who obviously cares about his guests' experience). A wonderfully therapeutic foodie escape evening; looking forward to my next chance to go here!

name: Accanto
review description: I've had good/great food here in the past, so I will likely go back, but I have to say that on July 17th, the entrees (a ravioli and the cornish game hen with polenta) were simply too salty to eat- and I love salt. Our server, Sterling, was excellent, catering to my dining partner, (who was new to many of the dishes), with respect and care, but the food was far below the usual quality.

name: Adobe Resort - Oregon
review description: This restaurant was very good with a menu full of tasty-sounding dishes. I had the seafood alfredo, and where other restaurants skimp on more expensive meats like crab, my dish at the Adobe had lots of sweet, delicious crab. The service was very attentive and friendly. The only aspect that didn't quite live up to my expectations was the salad bar. There were a few, fancier salad additions, but overall contained few choices. Desert, however, was fantastic!

name: Amadeus Manor
review description: This place has one of the most incredible views in Portland. Portland City Grill and The Chart House on Terwilliger are usually credited with the best views in Portland, but this little gem is definitely a contender. We were happy with our food and thought everything was great up until entrees, where it just stepped down to good. The entrees were a little bit overdone, not just overcooked, just too much in generall. My wife had a tenderloin steak, and any filet should be able to stand on it's own. However, they covered it in what can only be described as a blue cheese gravy with mushrooms and bacon.Shrimp w/lobster sauce App - 5 out of 5House Salad - 5 out of 5Mushroom soup - 5 out of 5Tenderloin - 3 out of 5Schnitzel - 4 out

name: Amuse Restaurant
review description: We went to Amuse on the recommendation of a friend, who tunes in to great restaurants. I say that because we arrived with high expectations. The service and the atmosphere lived up to them. The food fell short. It was competently prepared but not the memorable experience we had imagined. The prawn appetizer was the exception: it was excellent. My salad was bland and overdressed. We split the salmon as our main course. The blini with it had no flavor at all. And the pickled onion and cucumber preparation didn't quite come off. The chocolate truffle cake, which we had with chocolate truffle ice cream because we're not fond of coffee ice cream and they didn't have vanilla, finished the meal on a good note.

name: Andina
review description: Interesting small plates, very accommodating, rather noisy but lots of fun. Our party of 10 was lucky to have a round table near the windows which lessened the noise level & everyone (vegetarians & omnivores) loved the foods, wines & specialty cocktails.

name: Angel Thai
review description: Always yummy food. The Thai Salad with peanut sauce dressing is the best salad in Bend. The Orange Chicken is addicting. Most dishes, including the salad are big enough to share.

name: Apizza Scholls
review description: Great vegetarian and meat options, huge pizza's and willing to half-and-half pizzas. Always a great pizza!

name: Aquariva
review description: Good scallop entree, beet salad was standard. Wine list was good. Service was good once we got past the hostess. Bar was nice for a before dinner drink. Just nothing outstanding other than the view.

name: Aviary
review description: Food was very good but it was so noisy we had trouble talking and hearing the wait staff

name: Bastas Trattoria and Bar
review description: One of our favorite restaurants for the past 16 years. Marco and his terrific staff are consistently a+

name: The Bay House (OR)
review description: Warm and personable staff. Concise two page menu. Extensive wine list. European portions which is great. Fantastic view. An excellent dining experience.

name: Beaker & Flask
review description: Food was ok and the service was pour.

name: Beast
review description: The food was a 50% hit and miss. Some gems and some flops. There was a tendency to over salt a number of dishes including the brined roast chicken entree. The goat cheese dessert was pretty great. I can't recommend the wine pairings...they were pretty uninspired. I won't go again; for the price there is better elsewhere. The chef has talent which was evident in many of the flavor combinations although our party sensed that perhaps it has gotten a little routine and it misses the passion and excitement of serving great food.

name: Benihana - Beaverton
review description: It's an energetic place, very social place, Love the atmosphere. If you don't prefer to share your meal with strangers then this isn't the place for you, since you are forced to socialize with your fellow table mates whom some you won't even know. The pricing is a bit High which is basically on special occasions , we won't be able to afford to come here on a monthly basis. The food was divine!

name: The Benson Hotel
review description: I was very disappointed with Easter Brunch at the MayFair Room at the Benson. My family and I have been sharing holiday brunches at The Benson in the London Grill, hence that is what has made it a "fan favorite" with our family. With the closure of the London Grill the MayFair room was our only choice. The food was "fair" I almost tripped on the table cloth as it was dragging on the floor. We paid more this year for brunch and received a bad expreince. This was $200 not worth spending, we will not be returning.

name: The Bent Brick
review description: I made a reservation a week ago and they claimed not to have it, despite showing them the confirmation on my phone. The person who was "helping" us was both rude and dismissive. They did nothing to fix the situation and offered us a seat at the bar despite several open tables. We were dressed appropriately for the restaurant so I'm not sure why they didn't seem to want to seat us. We will not try it again as there are too many other restaurants in Portland with great service and good food.

name: Bentley's Grill - The Grand Hotel in Salem
review description: Was definitely disappointed. Went for our anniversary. Server was pleasant and timely. My husband & I both ordered a steak (same cut) and the waitress stated they tend to undercook so I asked for mine medium to medium well - I do not care for it bloody but like a good amount of pink inside (and explained what i wanted to the waitress) When it came, mine was so hard I could barely chew it while my husbands was extremely tender and he asked for it medium. I told the waitress about it but didnt send it back - should have! I hoped she would comp one of our desserts but no offer was made & I'm too chicken to ask & didn't want to make it a big deal given that it was our anniversary. The actual ambiance was nice but they sat us right next to the

name: Bistro 921
address: Hilton Portland 921 SW 6th Avenue Portland, OR  97204
review description: We arrived at happy hour so bar scene was pretty loud. We were seated as far from the noise as possible and all was good. Wait staff was friendly and attentive. The food was superb and in ample supply. Calamari cooked to perfection. Prices were quite reasonable especially considering portion size.

name: Black Angus Steakhouse - Vancouver
review description: Had a wonderful meal and so did my guests. We left nothing on our plates. The mud pie was outstanding. I have a sweettooth and so do my guests. Can't wait till I can have another day to go to THE BLACK ANGUS.

name: The Blacksmith Restaurant
review description: We did the Chef's Choice meal............Fabulous!

name: Bluehour
review description: The four of us had a great meal on a hot summer Friday night. The cheese starter was a good place to start. My buddy selected a nice red wine. We followed that with a nice appetizer. My Salmon entree was great. We ordered another excellent Red wine. Our wives were enjoying their meals. For dessert, I had the chocolate torte. Jeremy was our server and he did a good job. Extra plus that Bluehour is in the passport discount program.

name: The Boulevard Grill
review description: Prime rib was good cut of meat. Cooked medium, not medium rare. Bread could use an upgrade. Would prefer that the butter was not in patties that you had to unwrap. House salad could use some croutons. Having said this, my wife and I had apleasant, relaxed meal that overall we enjoyed.

name: Brasserie Montmartre
review description: Great atmosphere and a solid croque-madame. Nice touches here and there that set it apart from the herd without coming across as trying too hard. Love the interior design, expansive, nice balance of space and number of tables, high ceilings. Prompt, unobtrusive service with good suggestions and stealthy speed. A great place to bring a client for lunch during the week or your friends for brunch. Do your best to avoid the temptation to cram fistfuls of frites in your mouth...good stuff!

name: The Brickhouse - Bend
review description: Excellent service and food with a comfortable surrounding

name: The Brickhouse - Redmond
review description: The food was outstanding - a little spendy, but well worth the price. Definitely need reservations. The noise level was very high, made it difficult to talk to the person sitting across the table from you.

name: Brix Tavern
review description: The prime rib was not as good this time as previous times. Love the ancho chili sauce. If they bottled it, I'd buy it. The gratin potatoes had a funny flavor. I wouldn't order it again. The beet salad is fabulous as are the rolls. The heath bar brownie is great.

name: Broken Bread
review description: The food was wonderful. The salad ingredients came in from the local farm that day. The soup was unusual yet wonderful. The duck and halibut were cooked to perfection. I will be going back.

name: Cabezon Restaurant and Fish Market
review description: All courses were excellent and a great value. Wonderful appetizers. The service was attentive and well timed.

name: Cassidy's Restaurant & Bar
review description: Our waitress was terrific ... we arrived early and they gladly seated us. The variety and the value of the menu was terrific! We really couldn't think of something to say that they could have improved upon. A fabulous dining experience with good friends.

name: Castagna
review description: Do not recommend: Cannot explain how it made Forbes top 100 list as the food is not worth the money nor deserving to be in same company as others on the list. Service was almost nonexistent and repeatedly had to ask the server for refills from water to cocktails. The server showed no interest in the menu and had to be prompted to describe specials and other menu items. The food, although different which is why we went, left us still hungry and bad taste in our mouths.

name: Chart House Restaurant - Portland
review description: I've only been a couple times but both have left me pleased with the experience. The combination of the view, the food, and the service, are just amazing.

name: clarklewis
review description: A high school friend and I had a great meal at clarklewis. Luckily we were in the back part so we could chat and catch up. Clarklewis is not a quiet place -- I think a train came by at one point. The good news is the food and service make up for it. I had a great meal with a nice red wine. My friend also enjoyed her meal. I ordered a nice dessert with a wine pairing. Our server was very helpful. It a bonus that clarklewis is in the passport discount program.

name: Cocotte
review description: Fantastic Sturgeon, salad and cheese plate! Signature chicken was overcooked and somewhat dry but the Faro accompaniment was incredible. We'll be back-very nice for a casual dinner when you want terrific food with no fussiness.

name: Coppia/Vino Paradiso
review description: Copia is a Gem. The restaurant was quiet, wine list moderately priced and nice selection. This was the best Trout I ever had.

name: Daily Grill - Portland
review description: Service was wonderful. Food was fine but nothing special.

name: DaVinci Ristorante & Wine Bar
review description: Great place overall food service, will be coming back soon

name: Davis Street Tavern
review description: My second meal there and I was not disappointed. The best restaurant I've been to in a long time!

name: decarli
review description: I've had dinner at DeCarli's many times and always come away satisfied. Salmon dinner was excellent and just the right amount. I was dining with an old friend who I hadn't seen in a few years so we had a relaxing dinner getting caught up and the waiter did not rush us and let us enjoy the evening.

name: Del Alma
address: 136 SW Washington Ave STE 102 Corvallis, OR  97333
review description: Definitely one of the best restaurants in Corvallis and a good place to have an 'adult dinner' with partner or friends and an excellent spot for business dinners. Since the loss of the Gables, this is one of the few classy, quiet, reliable restaurants in Corvallis. Interesting spanish-tinged selections, artfully presented, friendly staff and a wine list featuring many Oregon wines and Spanish wines.

name: del INTI Restaurant
review description: Del INTI is our favorite GO TO place when we want a pop of flavor and several small plates for variety. Every dish we have had here is amazing! The service is friendly, atmosphere is elegant yet comfortable, and we can open table so we never have to wait. We love their ceviche options, the octopus is heavenly, and the quinoa is a must have every time.

name: Departure Restaurant and Lounge
review description: THE SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT! I had a great time. Props the staff they did everything i aske for. never going to forget it!

name: DOC
review description: Have had fabulous time here before with excellent servers....not the case this time. Food fantastic. Servers rushed, unfriendly, adequate.

name: Dragonwell Bistro
review description: Very well done. Excellent fish dishes and attention to detail. Hong Kong style Chinese food. Visited with Chinese relatives and we'll definitely go back. Parking can be a problem so plan ahead if you are driving and have a reservation.

name: East India Co. Grill & Bar
review description: Food was delicious, ambiance was nice. I would highly recommend to anyone who loves Indian food.

name: El Gaucho - Portland
review description: unbelievably expensive! more expensive than a high end new york steakhouse. completely unjustified.

name: Elevation
address: 2555 NW Campus Village Way Bend, OR  97701
review description: This is a college teaching venue. Food was good as was the service. Need to understand that mistakes will be made as the students are learning proper service. The food showed no mistakes but not quite up to "fine dining" experience but is approaching that quality. The room is a bit of a multi-use room so ambiance is not wonderful. However, the venue was nice and the facility is new. Outdoor dining very nice if the weather permits. Beverage menu limited but good and diners can bring in their own wine. Expect a $10 corkage. All in all it was a nice experience and what made it all worthwhile was being able to interact with students learning the trade and being able to support their learning experience.

name: Firehouse Restaurant
review description: Great restaurant, food right out of the wood fired oven, but out of hangar steak the night we visited, although disappointed the rest of the meal shined except for the pasta, the cavatelli were very tough and hard, but sauce was scrumptious as was the almond cake for dessert.

name: Five-0-Three
review description: Terrible service. First time for 2 foodies used to traveling into PDX for great dinners. Only one other couple at 6:00 on a Thursday, waiter took our order and never visited us voluntarily again, even after dropping off steak (ordered medium rare, was almost raw in middle). Had to flag down to get steak recooked and again to request desert menu (waiter never returned to ask if we wanted desert or another cocktail)again to request salt. Food here is well prepared but pricely so I expect to be waited on and this was a dissappointmen; we will not return

name: Fivespice Seafood & Wine Bar
address: 315 First Street Suite 201 Lake Oswego, OR  97034
review description: eVerything about Fivespice exudes YOU - they want YOU to enjoy, partake, request, and come back. Love this place and will definitely go back again and again.

name: Flatbread Community Oven - Bend
address: 375 SW Powerhouse Drive STE 130 Bend, OR  97702
review description: The staff at Flatbread couldn't have been more accommodating. We were seated in a back room to avoid most of the noise in the main dining area and the reasonably loud music that plays constantly in the background. The food was very good -- we had a great pizza that is one of the 5 Naples-certified. The crust was chewy and the toppings fresh. I would definitely return if I'm in the area.

name: Fratelli Ristorante & Bar
review description: Consistently one of the very best in the Pearl, or even in Portland!

name: Genoa Restaurant
review description: The reopened Genoa is just as good as ever. The food is fabulous, the service quietly elegant, and the decor simple but also elegant.

name: Gilda's Italian Restaurant
review description: Gilda's is one of the best Italian restaurants in Portland...while the service can be a little too slow, it is usually worth the wait for any of Marco's pasta dishes.

name: Gilt Club
review description: The food was very good. The service was outstanding.will return.

name: Gracie's
review description: we actually frequent gracies fairly often and have not been disappointed ever. the food and service are always excellent.

name: The Grant House
review description: Historic setting and great food, what more could you ask?

name: Greg's Grill
review description: My wife and I love the ambiance at Gregg's

name: Gruner
review description: Usually think of Gruner as excellent- close to dB Bistro in NY, but this visit was a little disappointing- but still very very good.

name: H5O bistro & bar
review description: I find it hard to give an accurate review of this establishment because of the date, I imagine the kitchen was understaffed due to the occasion (4th of july). The drinks were great, the food was passable, nothing special though, the waitstaff was friendly but slow, I arrived at 720 for a 730 reservation, I had the bar check us in, it took another 30 minutes to be seated. No matter how hard I tried I could not get the check until 930. Our waiter informed us that the staff likes to do everything at once, orders, food, checks, I nearly left cash on the table and walked out. Add to that the band playing music too loud to speak over fron 9 on and you get a pretty lame dining experience. I wont be back, but it wasn't a total disaster.

name: Hall Street Grill
review description: excellent service, we will be back

name: Hamburger Mary's
review description: This particular trip to Hamburger Mary's was VERY disappointing, although I like the restaurant generally. I made the reservation for 12 people about 2 months ago, upon arrival they crammed us all into one uncomfortable booth. We were almost literally siting on top of each other. The food was kinda nasty, several burgers showed up terribly undercooked, several food items showed up wrong/not as ordered. The floor show MC, Honey Bee, was great, but one of the singers, Todd Allen, was nothing short of painful to listen to. We were glad when the meal was over so we could get out of there. Ended up feeling embarrassed to have invited friends to go there for what was supposed to be a fun birthday celebration.

name: Hayden's Lakefront Grill
address: 8187 SW Tualatin Sherwood Road Tualatin, OR  97062
review description: Hayden Lakefront Grill serves simple dishes well prepared. We all had the prix fixe menu. The amount of food, even though the smaller portions, was more than ample. The only complaint was they were out of their special, braised short ribs. While tasty, the chicken saltimboca was a bit tougher than should be for chicken. Unfortunately, it was bit warm for lakefront seating, so we missed that bit of ambiance.

name: The Heathman Restaurant
review description: Their reconstruction of the black forest cale is DELICIOUS! Dinner was great too! Maybe it's time to enter Iron Chef - winner is creativity, visual and taste'

name: Henry's 12th Street Tavern
review description: The food and the beer were fantastic, but the service was really SLOWWW. 20+ minutes between checking on our group was a long time.

name: Hola! Sunriver
review description: Phone # listed is wrong, should be 541-593-8880. The made-at-our-table guacamole was very good. My halibut tacos were excellent. Good service. A step above the typical Mexican restaurant. Beautiful setting right on the Deschutes River.

name: Huber's Restaurant
review description: Excellent food. Amazing staff. I look forward to returning.

name: Iorio Restaurant
review description: very lovely place. friendly service. very efficient as well. Food delicious. Loved the beet salad! the best.

name: Irving St Kitchen
review description: very positive experience, server was great,food was excellent,a real upbeat and in restaurant

name: Ivories Jazz Lounge and Restaurant
review description: It was the music that drew us there. It is a good venue for jazz with a decent-sized stage, good piano, good house sound system, and good lighting. I don't particularly like the table arrangement for viewing the stage, but that's a problem anywhere. It lacks intimacy if you want to sit near the stage. The high ceilings seem to exaggerate the sense of being overly open. If I wasn't watching a band, I wouldn't want to linger there. The booths are at the far end of the room, so you have to choose between a booth with a poor view or a table with a good view. The bar is nice, and you have a good view of the stage from there. We've always had a good time there, since they book really great groups.

name: Jake's Famous Crawfish
review description: The entree was wonderful, as usual. However, the lump of plain white rice on the plate added nothing to the dinner.

name: Jake's Grill - Portland
review description: Jake's Grill has good food, but it's not worth the prices. Jake's Seafood is much better. There also seems to be items that are not on the menu, like a kid's menu and appetizers for parties. Our waiter suggested we get a larger appetizer, but didn't tell us the price (about $60). If you want a steak or nice dinner, there are better places, even within the McCormick & Schmitt's family. Been there for happy hour before, much better for that.

name: JORY Restaurant at The Allison Inn & Spa
review description: Everything at the Allison Resort & Spa was beyond amazing- including Jory! The food and service was amazing. We had breakfast, lunch & dinner there & loved each & every meal for different reasons :) The ambiance though was definitely one of my absolute favorite things about the restaurant. The view is breathtaking & the seating comfortable yet intimate. I want to go back very soon!

name: June
review description: I'm coming to the conclusion that Portland may be the best town for foodies in the US. First meal at June -- just spectacular. Low key unpretentious in a true Portland way -- the restaurant is a rehabbed auto garage-- with food that scores on every level. Not to be missed by those looking for great food.

name: La Capitale
review description: Food was fantastic. My friend and I ordered 4 small/share plates plus a cup of soup and grazed our way through a great meal. The heirloom salad with fresh mozz was out of this world. Service by Rebecca was friendly, efficient, and accommodating. One of the nicest places to dine in Salem.

name: La Rambla Restaurant & Bar
review description: Excellent food and great service; exceptional wine list; also, very good prices.

name: Lapellah Restaurant
address: 2520 Columbia House Blvd. Suite 108 Vancouver, WA  98661
review description: We had a great meal. The pork chop was delicious and my halibut was done perfectly with fresh seasonal vegetables. The menu was varied with a number of choices for anyones taste.We plan to return and enjoy the ambiance and good food again.. It was very nice to fine this type of resturant so close to home.

name: Larks - Home Kitchen Cuisine at The Ashland Springs Hotel
review description: Excellent location, ambience, good food, good wine. Third time here visiting from CA in three years. Quality remains

name: Le Bouchon
review description: One of the best translations of a true French Bistro That I've found in this country. I go as often as I can. Well thought out wine list. Great place for a mealtime conversation.

name: Le Pigeon
review description: Everything was great, the staff and food. It lives up to its reputation. However, one problem which was, we had to wait 25 minutes for a table. We appreciate that this can happen, but what made it annoying was that received a call the day before reminding us of our reservations and to be on time.

name: Limo Peruvian Restaurant
review description: Delicious and unusual food, we were well attended to. Limo is a great spot for and we enjoyed a fabulous anniversary dinner there. There was a loud table of birthday party celebrators with raised voices which made it difficult to had at our table, but it was happy noises and tolerable. I recommend Limo, the appetizer of shrimp and coconut with yuca was sublime.

name: Lincoln Restaurant
address: 3808 N Williams Ave Ste 127 Portland, OR  97227-1468
review description: Lincoln continues to be one of my all time favorites, especially for visiting guests.

name: Little Bird
review description: Tables were too close..could hear conversations next to us. Food was very good and uniquely prepared

name: The Lodge Restaurant at Black Butte Ranch
address: 12930 Hawks Beard Black Butte Ranch, OR  97759
review description: Always outstanding. Impossible to beat the ambiance, view, food and service anywhere in Central Oregon!

name: M & S Grill - Tigard
review description: When you're in the mood for seafood, this is an excellent and reliable choice. My sockeye salmon was grilled perfectly. They also have half-bottles of wine, which is nice when your spouse will only drink one glass. When the bar is full--which is normal--the noise can carry over to the restaurant tables.

name: Madison's Grill
review description: A Gem of a place with fantastic food

name: Mama Mia Trattoria
review description: I visit Mama Mia's multiple times a year. And for the most part it is a great/romantic little spot. I would highly reccomw d this Ittalian gem. Food is excellent and the service is usually great. I will however say that my last experience was unpleasant. Maybe the server was just having a rough night. I used to wait tables myself so I am very jnderstanding and patient when it comes to poor servicei. But this last time was so bad that I even complained to the manager. That MIHHT be on a once in a 5 year time frame. Although I will eat there again, I will have a hard time forgetting such poor service. Great food and usually great service. I guess we just happen to eat there on an off night. Thank you

name: Manzana - Lake Oswego
review description: MY fish tacos did not have any fish in them!! Tasteless!My husband's crab sandwich had more filler than crab.

name: Marche
review description: Marche can be counted on for both great food and service

name: Masu Sushi
review description: Yummy food. Good service. Good ambiance. Go there. You'll like it.

name: McCormick & Schmick's Harborside - Portland
review description: The occasion was my brother's 75th birthday. It couldn't have been better!The food was outstanding. Our steaks were perfectly prepared (he had filet mignon;I had rib-eye). Our waiter, Brian, was extremely helpful. He suggested a wine whichturned out to be an outstanding Oregon pinot-noir. The evening was a total success!

name: McCormick's Fish House - Beaverton
review description: While everyone was wonderful at your location the food was average at best. I can say I was a bit disapointed as I give the HIGHEST marks for "Jake's Crawfish". Maybe it was what I ordered or just got a bad round. I don't think I will be dining there again.

name: The Melting Pot - Portland
address: Corner of SW 6th Avenue & Main Street Portland, OR  97204
review description: Always a highlight of our anniversary celebration. Too bad Sean Culley is leaving. We keep coming back because of Kelly. She is definitely fantastic at her job.

name: Meriwether's Restaurant & Skyline Farm
review description: The food and service at Meriwether's is always wonderful. We're so lucky we live near by.

name: Metrovino
review description: Great place in the north end of the Pearl. Fantastic wine by the glass selection!! Dined outside and the noise was minimal to moderate.

name: Mingo
review description: My wife and I spent our first anniversary there, and it was metiocre at best. The server was good, but as a whole, they could do a lot better. The chef could execute a little better, as the menu describes better than actual. We might try again for happy hour, or something more casual than our anniversary.

name: Monteaux's Public House
address: 16165 SW Regatta Lane, STE 1000 Beaverton, OR  97006
review description: food and service were GREAT! we will be going back for sure! The waiter was very friendly and honest when asked about menu.

name: Morton's The Steakhouse - Portland
review description: Food was good but not awesome. Convenient to Keller and they made a good effort to make sure we were on time for the play. Good wine list but super expensive.

name: Natural Selection
review description: I found this place from Unique Eats and made it a destination on our trip. It was the best meal I've ever had and loved the vegan and gluten free choices!

name: Ned Ludd
review description: Ned Ludd was great! The food was outstanding. The wait staff were informative and friendly. The flatbread was incredible, as were the pork noodles, the charred broccoli, the salads, everything! Go with lots of people and try everything!

name: The Nehalem River Inn
review description: We love this place! We are trying to go as often as possible before they close on August 12, 2012 :-( If you've been thinking about trying this beautiful food, HURRY!

name: Nel Centro
review description: Nel Centro again lived up to its reputation. Wonderful food and excellent service all in a chic urban setting. The noise level can be a bit of a difficulty for conversation though so would not recommend for a romantic dinner.

name: Newport Bay - Tanasbourne
address: 2865 NW Town Center Loop Beaverton, OR  97006
review description: This location is best for meeting family from multiple locations. The whole dining experience is great.

name: Newport Seafood Grill - Lloyd Center
review description: We had a group of 17 (from White Rock, Canada) and went to the Newport seafood Grill to celebrate finishing the Seattle to Portland bike ride. The service and food were excellent - especially given that we had such a large group! Thanks for accommodating such a large group!

name: Newport Seafood Grill - Salem
review description: The service was very good, I appreciated the placement of my dinner party. Through an online reservation I asked for a private are for a business setting quiet enough to hear conversation. Food was great. The only suggestion would be to provide a patron with more fresh vegetables or salads this time of year. Seafood was cooked perfectly. I could tell we were the only reservation, I didn't need to say who I was before the greeter said the table was ready. Just a thought if I were a guy with a date...even fake it looking up my name just for the appearance of having a reservation being important, don't come out and indirectly say ''you're the only person that made a reservation''. The chair I was sitting on had some sticky gunk on it.

name: Noble Rot
address: 1111 East Burnside Fourth Floor Portland, OR  97214
review description: I had one of the best dishes in my dining experience there... with produce from the rooftop garden and such a fresh and interesting mix of flavors... it was awesome! Called Campfire S'mores it had fava beans, quinoa, mole and ricotta cheese cakes, cleverly arranged to look like S'mores. Best of all, it was delicious.

name: Nora's Table
review description: Enjoyable experience from start to finish. We both had the delicious salmon as main course. Huge dessert was perfect for sharing. Dining area is a bit cozy, but perfectly fine once you get accustomed to it. There appeared to be only one server on the Tuesday we dined, and there was a bit of a wait between the time we were seated and the time she came to our table, but service was perfectly fine after that. Disappointed that our bottle of white wine was simply placed on the table and not in a wine bucket to keep chilled during the meal on a very warm day.

name: Oba
review description: Great food, great service. Oba is a very well run restaurant that offers a terrific dining experience.

name: Old Wives' Tales
review description: Charming waitstaff, fresh ingredients, vegetarian-friendly.

name: The Original
review description: The food and service were great. The ambiance was good but I think getting rid of the formica (though trying to go retro) would be good. Some of the seat cushions in the booths were stained.

name: Ox & Fin
review description: Perhaps because it was Sunday, but Sfizio was "out" of a lot of items on the menu e.g. manilla clams, salmon special, pork chop...This seemed excessive.

name: Paadee
review description: Great Thai.Great atmosphere. I really like the big tables.

name: The Painted Lady
review description: Excellent food and service.Great for special occasion.

name: Paragon - Portland
review description: Outdoor table was great. Service is always good. Chip sandwich is great

name: The Parish
review description: Fabulous food. Great location. The touffe and Gumbo are to die for. Highly recommended.

name: Park Kitchen
review description: Almost there for three hours, slowest service I have ever experienced.

name: Paule
review description: Innovative, beautifully presented creations by Daniel Montuk - great combinations of flavors and textures make this a destination dining experience.

name: Pazzo Ristorante
review description: Came in during lunch and it took over 20 mins to get water. Then we waited another 10 min to order. We had to speed our way through after getting our entrees.

name: The Phoenix Restaurant
review description: We were staying in Bend for a concert and thought The Phoenix would be a good restaurant to hit up on our way. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered off the 3 course menu and got quite a bit of food. My husband had the salmon piccata and I had the fish and chips. They brought us fresh baked bread and we would definitely when vacationing in Bend again.

name: Pine Tavern Restaurant
review description: Always reliable eating experience - great!

name: Ping Restaurant
review description: Enjoyed the small plates although the baby octopus was tough--when informed, they took immediate action and removed the item from our bill. No A/C, but big fans. Very small venue and very friendly, but food wasn't memorable. I had much higher expectations.

name: Pink Rose
review description: I love this place! The staff is amazing!

name: Portland City Grill
review description: This was an amazing experience. Just a little too noisy. Crab cakes, wedge salad and steaks are incredible!! Not to mention the view! Phenomenal!

name: Portland Prime
review description: Very good food, great service, nice ambiance.

name: Portland Seafood Co. - Mall 205
review description: Our waitress was very good, the food was awesome but two things went wrong. One and the most important was that we had to wait over 30 min for our food after we had our appetizer & salads. To make up for that the waitress gave me a free dessert. With over half the place empty and we were early for our reservations, the hostess still had us wait 15 min to be seated. Still can't understand that.

name: Portland Seafood Co. - Washington Square
address: 9699 SW Washtington Square Road Tigard, OR  97223
review description: We have always enjoyed RUI restaurants, especially Scott's in north Seattle. The food was fine but the waiter Ty was very good, a real keeper.

name: Porto Terra
address: Hilton Portland 830 SW 6th Avenue Portland, OR  97204
review description: Pretty mediocre food, service was pretty slow. Staff was nice, but for the price it's really not worth it.

name: Portobello Vegan Trattoria
address: 1125 SE Division Street Suite 102 Portland, OR  97202
review description: Delicious food and great service!!

name: Red Star
review description: My wife and I had a very special evening celebrating and our dinner at Red Star was superb!Our waiter, Rusty, was energetic, entertaining and very informative about weaving our way through the dining experience.He did an amazing job and at the end of dinner we discovered that he only recently started working at the Red Star. His level of service and knowledge of the menu rivaled that of the servers at Jake's!

name: Riffle NW
review description: While the food preparations were creative and innovative, the prices were still high for the portion size. The shaved brussels sprout salad was unique and of good value. The service was a bit rough given that one dish that was ordered was never delivered and a request for an "entree" size portion on an appetizer was neither delivered or explained that it could not be done. Also, a request for some crackers resulted in an additional charge of $3.00 with no advisement up front. The server compensated for this with a complimentary dessert which was truly appreciated.The atmosphere is comfortable with nice lighting and wonderfully opened to the outside through large windows and doors.

name: RingSide Fish House - Fox Tower
review description: We enjoyed the resturant. Other resturants we like better. Not likely we would return

name: RingSide Steakhouse  Eastside
review description: Food excellent as usual. Food was ample. As if get older I normally have food dfor lunch the next day. Seemed very noisy compared to other fvisits. Could it have been the warm summer everning???

name: RingSide Steakhouse  Uptown
review description: By far the best steak and butter poached lobster tail we've ever had. I highly recommend this place.

name: Rivershore Bar & Grill
review description: Difficult to find parking was our first impression. We had made reservations, but weren't asked when we arrived. Server brought the 'lemon water' I requested without lemon--twice. Every other table got bread; we had to ask for ours. The entrees took a LONG time to come. The food was average, nothing special. The salmon with lobster sauce that I had was the special. It tasted like BBQ sauce, but the salmon was pretty good. I would consider coming back for lunch if we got an outdoor table; but, probably won't come back for dinner. Unimpressive,

name: Riverview Restaurant
review description: Had a great romantic dinner. Our server, Tuesday, was very friendly and helpful. Love this restaurant -- will be back for all future special occassions!

name: Rock Bottom Brewery - Portland
review description: Great location, smack-dab in the heart of downtown Portland, with the MAX commuter train stopping literally at the front door for people coming in from various locations.

name: Roots Restaurant and Bar
review description: We had not been to Roots in over a year since our last visit was disappointing. However, this time the filet mignon was excellent and although as other reviews mentioned the prices can be a little high, I don't mind paying that if the steak is done properly. The service was also noteworthy. I would definitely recommend it again to friends.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Portland
review description: Best steak I have ever had! And I have dined at Ringside, El Goucho... Love them as well, but this was superb. The only odd thing was that everything had a calorie count. Kind of depressing when you are craving a good ribeye and its 1400 calories... My much lower calorie filet was FANTASTIC!

name: Salty's on the Columbia
review description: Fantastic meal and service. Brought guests from France and they both felt this was one of the best meals they have had in the USA. The Friday night jazz combo put the entire evening over the top. Definitely would recommend the crab cakes and the surf and turf.

name: Saucebox
review description: The food was wonderful, interesting, lots of great flavors. Wow!

name: Serratto
review description: We liked the ease of the online reservations. We included a note in our reservation that we were celebrating a special wedding anniversary. When we were seated, we were brought complimentary champagne, and our dessert was comped. Service and food were excellent, and prices are reasonable, too.

name: Silk Vietnamese Restaurant
review description: Out of key ingredients for 2 of 3 drinks I requested. Out of one of their "signature" dishes. It was 7 PM on a Thursday.

name: St Jack
review description: The appetizer of pork face meat, not cheeks, was mediocre. The trout entree was wonderful and the dessert of meringue, berries and creme anglaise was delicious. The wines by the glass list was short and the wines we tried were not drinkable. They did have an extensive list of wine by the bottle; however, pricing was a little on the high side. The staff was very attentive and our server was very helpful.

name: Stanford's - Clackamas
review description: Ffish taco weak-time between order and food excessive

name: Stanford's - Jantzen Beach
address: 1440 N Jantzen Beach Ctr Portland, OR  97217
review description: Food was delicious. Excellent service.

name: Stanford's - Kruse Way (Lake Oswego)
address: 14801 Kruse Oaks Blvd Lake Oswego, OR  97035
review description: Close to crowne plaza hotel, easy walk.

name: Stanford's - Lloyd Center
review description: The food was very pricey and I would think for the price it was not to the quality that I would expect.

name: Stanford's - Tanasbourne
review description: We had a group work lunch and everyone was very pleased with the food they ordered - something for everyone, a great variety of dishes. We were able to visit at normal conversational levels, which was very nice. The wait staff was personable, attentive and just plain wonderful. We will definetly be back! The "boss" was especially pleased with the food and service. :-)

name: The Stockpot Broiler
address: 8200 SW Scholls Ferry Rd Beaverton, OR  97008
review description: I enjoy coming to this restaurant. Food quality, quality of service and setting are all good.

name: Stone Cliff Inn
address: 17900 S Clackamas River Dr Carver, OR  97045
review description: As always the food was incredible. The service was prompt, friendly and always appropriate for timing for the courses. Wee always want to come to Stone Cliff when celebrating....anything. thanks for the wonderful evening.

name: Sunday Antidote
review description: I find the idea of sitting and watching the chef prepare our food and talk to us about what he's doing. He changed the menu at the last minute because of what he found at the farmers market. He is very passionate about food and would recommend this to anyone who is a foodie or wants a personal brunch experience.

name: Sweetwaters on the River
review description: Maitre'd Marty worked as our server as normal wait staff had several large parties while we were there. Marty's service was attentive and his suggestions from the dessert menu at the end of the meal were delicious.

name: Tabla Mediterranean Bistro
review description: To start, the drinks were a bit heavy handed...I'd usually never complain about a heavy handed drink but my buddy's drink was so heavy handed that it was tainting his palette to the extent that he wasn't able to taste the food over the alcohol. The octopus salad was very good, the veal meatballs were good but the pasta (ravioli and black pepper fettucini) dishes were not seasoned properly.

name: Tapalaya
review description: Tapalaya was something of a surprise to me. Great food and atmosphere. Loved the small plates that we could share around the table and the waitress was exceltional for us.

name: Thirst Wine Bar & Bistro
review description: only had one beer on tap (not as their menu suggested). Small menu to start and they were out of soup ( had an alternate with cream so NO), out of their beet salad, out of their brussel sprouts (had a substitution) and out of the wine we chose off the menu. The gluten-free option for the burger was less than favorable since they didn't get their order that day. Very sad due to the fact that it is our favorite restaurant on the riverfront. With two of the owners present at the time, an apology would have been in order. The waiter was clueless as to what the restaurant had and didn't have. It was well into the 30 minute wait for food that we were told.

name: Thirsty Lion at Washington Square
address: 10205 SW Washington Square Rd Tigard, OR  97223
review description: Just wonderful. Food was delicious and service was great.

name: Three Degrees
review description: Nice atmosphere - view of the river. We've had brunch there twice and food was delicious.

name: Tina's
review description: We expected more from a well-reviewed wine country restaurant. It was a slow night, and perhaps an off night. Our server was not at all knowledgeable about the very local wine list, nor was she particularly pleasant or attentive to us all night. We're not tough to please, or demanding. The service was slow, and we left most of the dishes in our party of 5 half-eaten. My duck was overlooked, and my son's gnocchi dish was a mess. I saw a menu on the wall from 1996 that was far more inventive and fresh-looking than today's. The desserts followed the same low-risk formula that you might see at a hotel, with one chocolate dish, a creme brle...you get the idea.

name: Tommy O's Pacific Rim Bistro - Downtown
review description: Happy hour food is awesome. Too loud in the lounge - but he restaurant area was quiet & good for a group.

name: Tommy O's Pacific Rim Grill
review description: Would highly recommend the Lobster potstickers, the sushi and the macadamia-encrusted halibut!

name: Touche Restaurant & Bar
review description: We were there for an early dinner, so we used the Happy Hour menu. The service was very friendly and attentive. The pizza and gyro were very good. Caprese salad was disappointing. Cheese was grainy, tomatoes were not ripe, very little basil or dressing. I would not order that again.

name: Trader Vic's
review description: Really great cocktails, good atmosphere. On warm evenings, the walls of windows on two sides of the restaurant are opened so that it's an open air sort of feel. The foh staff and bar staff were exceptional, but our dinner waiter was not. Overall, though, it was a fun evening. We were there for my wife's birthday, and I was tryin to surprise her with some friends. The foh staff did everything they could to help facilitate the surprise and to make my wife feel special on her birthday. The food is okay, not great by any stretch. But, the cocktails were great and very well executed. Fun place to go with a large group where the evening is centered on good company, atmosphere, and plenty of drinks. Again, all but our waiter were exceptional.

name: Trebol Mexican
review description: Food was good but service was nonexistent.

name: Truss
review description: Great ambiance and wonderful overall experience. Very courteous service, and quality food. The only negative was the somewhat limited menu, but we all found choices we were happy with.

name: Tucci Ristorante
review description: Great place! Friendly service! Unbelievably good food!

name: Uptown Billiards Club
review description: Excellent service and food. Five course menu is a deal.

name: Urban Farmer
review description: I thought the portion sizes on beef way to big I would have preferred smaller piece with reduction in cost

name: Urban Fondue
review description: It was awesome! I absolutely loved the selection and will DEFINITELY be going there again. Their dessert is to die for!

name: Venti's Cafe & Taphouse
review description: I had mentioned in my online reservation that we wanted a table outside. It wasnt even offered to us. They had a bunch of tables open. Would of made the evening better.

name: Vindalho
review description: My favorite restaurant currently. Love the food, service, and the place. Thanks.

name: The Vintage Room at The Reserve Golf Course
review description: Great place to eat! Don't miss it!

name: The Wayfarer Restaurant and Lounge
review description: We were a party of three with two different appetizers and three different entrees. The Lettuce Wedge was very flavorful and fresh with quality ingredients. The Crab Cakes were 95% crab with a shrimp mousse as a binder. The aoli sauce was so good I even dipped bread into it! My Rex Sole was very delicate and perfectly cooked and paired well with the rice. My sister had the Halibut again perfectly prepared. My wife had the Chicken Florentine (stuffed with crab!). We would fully recommend all items and my wife are going back tonight!

name: Wildwood Restaurant and Bar
review description: Other than the missing reservation via Open Table it was fine.

name: Wilf's Restaurant & Bar
address: 800 NW 6th Ave at Union Station Portland, OR  97209
review description: The new decor is an improvement. Food and service were outstanding. A bit expensive though.

name: The Woodsman Tavern
review description: Oysters Oysters Oysters and a crab!

name: Yakuza Lounge
review description: Yakuza burger was super, as was the snap pea salad. Excellent local beer on tap, although it took forever to get it. Restaurant is attractive with a very pretty garden area.

name: Zeppo Italian Restaurant
review description: We enjoyed our anniversary dinner here very much. The salmon was wonderful!
